law.catch_line: Applicant may have hearing before license is rejected.

text.section: If a state director rejects an application, the director shall notify the applicant of his or her decision by registered mail at the address given in the application or supplement.

The applicant may, within thirty (30) days after the date of the mailing of the notice from the director, indicate, in writing, his or her desire for a hearing. The hearing shall be conducted by the board or persons designated by the board in compliance with the requirements of KRS Chapter 13B.

law.history: Amended 1998 Ky. Acts ch. 121, sec. 21, effective July 15, 1998. -- Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. sec. 2554b-140.
